details.title: Compressed sensing for SAR-based wideband three-dimensional microwave imaging system using non-uniform fast fourier transform

authors.affiliation: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, Missouri University of Science and Technology
authors.name: Hamed Kajbaf

authors.affiliation: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, Missouri University of Science and Technology
authors.name: Joseph T. Case

authors.affiliation: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, Missouri University of Science and Technology
authors.name: Zengli Yang

authors.affiliation: Electrical and Computer Engineering Department, Missouri University of Science and Technology
authors.name: Yahong Rosa Zheng

details.abstract: A new compressed sensing (CS) image reconstruction method is proposed for high-resolution wideband threedimensional synthetic aperture radar (SAR) imaging systems. In contrast to existing CS SAR methods that employ only a forward SAR transform in pre- or post-processing, the proposed method employs both forward SAR and reverse SAR (R-SAR) transforms in each CS iteration to improve the quality of reconstructed images. This study proposes a simple and elegant truncation repair method to combat the truncation error and utilises non-uniform fast Fourier transform to reduce the SAR and R-SAR transform errors, thereby ensuring the convergence of the CS algorithm and improving the quality of the reconstructed images. The proposed CS SAR method is applied to microwave and millimeter wave imaging systems for non-destructive evaluation of materials embedded in stratified media. Three different specimens under test are measured by conventional uniform sampling and by random under-sampling with 20% or 30% spatial points of the uniform sampling. The reconstructed images show that, albeit having much less measurement points, the proposed CS method achieves better image quality and lower background artefacts than the images reconstructed from the fullysampled uniform measurements.

ieee.title: A new multi-frequency compressed sensing model for 2-D near-field synthetic aperture radar
ieee.displayText: Dongjie Bi, Yahong Rosa Zheng, "A new multi-frequency compressed sensing model for 2-D near-field synthetic aperture radar", Wireless Communications & Signal Processing (WCSP) 2016 8th International Conference on, pp. 1-5, 2016, ISSN 2472-7628.

ieee.title: Application of emission source microscopy technique to EMI source localization above 5 GHz
ieee.displayText: Pratik Maheshwari, Victor Khilkevich, David Pommerenke, Hamed Kajbaf, Jin Min, "Application of emission source microscopy technique to EMI source localization above 5 GHz", Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC) 2014 IEEE International Symposium on, pp. 7-11, 2014, ISSN 2158-1118.

ieee.title: Wideband Microwave Camera for Real-Time 3-D Imaging
ieee.displayText: Mohammad Tayeb Ghasr, Matthew J. Horst, Matthew R. Dvorsky, Reza Zoughi, "Wideband Microwave Camera for Real-Time 3-D Imaging", Antennas and Propagation IEEE Transactions on, vol. 65, pp. 258-268, 2017, ISSN 0018-926X.

ieee.title: Microwave Imaging of Nonsparse Domains Using Born Iterative Method With Wavelet Transform and Block Sparse Bayesian Learning
ieee.displayText: Lei Guo, Amin M. Abbosh, "Microwave Imaging of Nonsparse Domains Using Born Iterative Method With Wavelet Transform and Block Sparse Bayesian Learning", Antennas and Propagation IEEE Transactions on, vol. 63, pp. 4877-4888, 2015, ISSN 0018-926X.

ieee.title: Near-Field Two-Dimensional Synthetic Aperture Microwave Imaging Based on Compressed Sensing
ieee.displayText: Chao Sun, Baoping Wang, Yang Fang, "Near-Field Two-Dimensional Synthetic Aperture Microwave Imaging Based on Compressed Sensing", Computational Intelligence and Communication Networks (CICN) 2015 International Conference on, pp. 34-38, 2015, ISSN 2472-7555.

ieee.title: Compressed sensing with non-uniform fast fourier transform for radial Ultra-short Echo Time (UTE) MRI
ieee.displayText: Xiahan Yang, Yahong Rosa Zheng, Ming Yang, Lixin Ma, "Compressed sensing with non-uniform fast fourier transform for radial Ultra-short Echo Time (UTE) MRI", Biomedical Imaging (ISBI) 2015 IEEE 12th International Symposium on, pp. 918-921, 2015.

ieee.title: The Development of an EM-Field Probing System for Manual Near-Field Scanning
ieee.displayText: Hui He, Pratik Maheshwari, David J. Pommerenke, "The Development of an EM-Field Probing System for Manual Near-Field Scanning", Electromagnetic Compatibility IEEE Transactions on, vol. 58, pp. 356-363, 2016, ISSN 0018-9375.

ieee.title: Emission Source Microscopy Technique for EMI Source Localization
